key_points: Vice President Kamala Harris' interview on ABC's 'The View' was delayed due to co-hosts Sunny Hostin and Ana Navarro testing positive for COVID-19.
Hostin and Navarro, despite being fully vaccinated, experienced 'breakthrough' infections and abruptly left the show.
Harris conducted the interview remotely within the studio's building to ensure safety.
Joy Behar, co-host of 'The View', informed viewers of the situation and reassured measures to keep Vice President Harris safe.
Vice President Harris emphasized the significance of vaccinations, attributing the non-severe status of the co-hosts to being vaccinated.
Deputy press secretary Sabrina Singh confirmed Harris hadn't contacted the hosts prior to the show and her schedule would proceed as planned.
Harris criticized the aggressive actions of border agents against Haitian migrants, likening it to dark episodes of American history.
She highlighted the importance of accountability and consequences for the agents involved.
Harris called for increased assistance for Haiti to help the nation recover from natural disasters and political instability.
Despite the disruption, Harris addressed crucial issues like COVID-19, immigration, and foreign aid during her appearance.
spokespersons: Sabrina Singh (Deputy Press Secretary, Vice President Kamala Harris)
